content.stem:
A student is writing a story for his English class about being late for school one day. Read the beginning paragraphs from the story and complete the task that follows.


This morning, I woke up late. My alarm clock never went off! The only reason I woke up at all was because I heard my dog barking. I walked down the hall to my mother's room to find she was still in bed. “Mom! Wake up,” I yelled. “I think we both overslept.” I looked over at the clock and it was 7:30 a.m. School starts in one hour – great!


I ran into the bathroom. There, I brushed my teeth, washed my face, and then looked in the mirror. My hair was standing straight up! I combed it down with water as fast as I could.


After that, I threw on some clothes and shoes. Racing into the kitchen, I grabbed my backpack from the table and an apple from the fruit bowl. “Bye, Mom!” I yelled as I pushed through the screen door letting it slam shut behind me.


As I ran for the sidewalk, I watched the bus pull away from the curb and turn down the next street. Soon it was out of sight.


In one or two paragraphs, write an ending to the story that follows from the events and experiences in the story.

rubric.name: Rubric 2
rubric.val:
The response:
• provides a transition from the “body of the story” to the conclusion
• provides a satisfying ending to the story related to being late for school and missing the bus that provides closure and/or follows logically from the events or experiences in the story

sample.name: 2-Point Official Sample Answer
sample.samplecontent: I ran like lightning to school. Thankfully my school was only a half mile from my house. On the way, I tore into my apple with a loud “CRUNCH!.” It took me about five minutes to get there, and I was breathing like a dog on a hot summer day. Even though I was tired I was so happy that I made it on time to school…with one minute to spare. That was close!

rubric.name: Rubric 1
rubric.val:
The response:
• provides a limited transition from the “body of the story” to the conclusion
• provides a general or partial ending to the story related to being late for school and missing the bus that may provide some closure and/or somewhat follow logically from the events or experiences in the story

sample.name: 1-Point Official Sample Answer
sample.samplecontent: I didn't know what to do. I decided to walk to school. As I got closer I could see my friends in the distance. I ran to them so we could all walk to school together.

rubric.name: Rubric 0
rubric.val:
The response:
• provides no transition from the “body of the story” to the conclusion
• provides an unclear or incomplete ending to the story related to being late for school and missing the bus that provides little or no closure and/or does not follow logically from the events or experiences in the story

sample.name: 0-Point Official Sample Answer
sample.samplecontent: I don't like to take the bus. I would just be late for school.

readAloud.textToSpeechPronunciation: Quote, Mom! Wake up, End quote,
readAloud.textToSpeechPronunciationAlternate: Quote, Mom! Wake up, End quote,

readAloud.textToSpeechPronunciation: Quote, I think we both overslept. End quote,
readAloud.textToSpeechPronunciationAlternate: Quote, I think we both overslept. End quote,
